meanings.definition: The quality or state of being canonical.
meanings.sent1: The canonicities of the ancient text were highly respected.
meanings.sent2: The professor discussed the canonicities of the literary works.
meanings.sent3: The debate over the canonicities of the rules led to some humorous misunderstandings.
meanings.sent4: Her adherence to the canonicities of etiquette was like following a strict code.
meanings.sent5: The artist's attention to the canonicities of proportions made his paintings stand out.

meanings.definition: The accepted or authoritative list of books in a particular religion.
meanings.sent1: The library displayed the canonicities of the holy scriptures prominently.
meanings.sent2: Scholars study the canonicities of the religious texts to understand their significance.
meanings.sent3: The monks had a lighthearted discussion about the canonicities of the sacred texts.
meanings.sent4: The canonicities of the religious books served as a guiding light for the believers.
meanings.sent5: Memorizing the canonicities of the scriptures was essential for the ceremony.
